r.s: Access to some Win32 usefull API.
r.d: Contains: - RES (access to resource of .exe/.dll files on Win32) - RES stream wrapper for reading. Compatible with the res protocol defined by MS - REGISTRY access - Common Win32 dialogs (open/save file, open dir, message boxes) - Wrapper for some standard function (win_shell_execute, win_play_wav, win_beep, win_create_link)
